context: A security incident involving a remote session dropping and executing a file named `rubeus.exe` on host `vnevado-win10b` with IP address `141.216.110.153` was detected. This activity is related to the use of the Rubeus kerberoasting tool, designed to exploit Kerberos authentication. The process was executed with command line: `rubeus.exe dump /service:xfbzkp /user:lucasb`, and the incident was traced back to the suspicious account `fk8mq` with Azure AD user ID `97e6a954-b6bd-48a5-808c-bd8464cce677`.
question: During the investigation, an anomalous chain of attempts to look up user account information was observed. Can you identify the name of the suspicious file associated with this alert?
solution_steps: A file named `rubeus.exe` was dropped and launched from a remote location.

Activity indicating the use of the Rubeus tool, which can perform kerberoasting and other Kerberos authentication attacks, was observed. The suspect account has AadUserId `1d94aaf6-efe6-4e76-ad56-ffd7d1257bc1`.
An anomalous account lookup was performed using the file `domaindominance27.ps1`.
